intro: Sphaeralcea leptophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its globular, yellow flower heads that resemble small globes, which are surrounded by narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Sphaeralcea leptophylla is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
